    • Constructor Detail

      • Boxes

        public Boxes(int cols,
             int rows)
        Construct a cols * rows array of boxes.
        Parameters:
        cols - the number of columns in the box array.
        rows - the number of rows in the box array.

    • Method Detail

      • getBoxNoContainingPoint

        public int getBoxNoContainingPoint(java.awt.Point p,
                                   java.awt.Dimension d)
        Find the box within the array containing a particular point.
        Parameters:
        p - the point to locate within one of the particular boxes
        d - the size of the overall array of boxes, in pixels.
        Returns:
        the box number containing the given point.

      • getBoxSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getBoxSize(java.awt.Dimension dimension)
        For the supplied dimension of the entire array of boxes, return the size of one (any) box. The returned box width is the dimension width divided by the number of columns, and the height is the dimension height divided by the number of rows.
        Parameters:
        dimension - the size of the overall array of boxes, in pixels
        Returns:
        the size of an individual box within the array.

      • getBoxes

        public java.util.Vector<java.awt.Rectangle> getBoxes(java.awt.Dimension dimension)
        For the given dimension of the entire array of boxes, return a vector of Rectangles describing the corners of each box, in row-major order.
        Parameters:
        dimension - the size of the overall array of boxes, in pixels.
        Returns:
        a Vector of Rectangles representing individual boxes, in row-major order.

      • getMidPoint

        public java.awt.Point getMidPoint(java.awt.Dimension dimension,
                                  int boxNo)
        Given supplied dimension of the entire array of boxes, return the midpoint of the nth box (starting with n = 0).
        Parameters:
        dimension - the dimensions of the overall array of boxes.
        boxNo - the number of the box to retrieve (row major order)
        Returns:
        the midpoint of the nth Box.

      • getMidPoints

        public java.util.Vector<java.awt.Point> getMidPoints(java.awt.Dimension dimension)
        For the given dimension of the entire array of boxes, return a vector of Points describing the midpoints of each box, in row-major order.
        Parameters:
        dimension - the dimension of the entire array of boxes, in pixels
        Returns:
        a Vector of box midpoints, in row-major order.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                 java.awt.Dimension dimension)
        Draw boxes on a Graphics2D context.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics2D on which drawing is to take place.
        dimension - the size of the overall grid of boxes.
